meanings.definition: An introductory section of a literary work.
meanings.sent1: The prologues in the book set the stage for the story.
meanings.sent2: She always reads the prologues of novels to get a sense of the plot.
meanings.sent3: The prologues were like a sneak peek into the adventure awaiting the readers.
meanings.sent4: The prologues acted as a gateway to the magical world within the pages.
meanings.sent5: The prologues were like the opening act of a grand performance.

meanings.definition: A preliminary or introductory event or action.
meanings.sent1: The meeting served as a prologues to the main discussion.
meanings.sent2: The prologues of the party included a warm welcome from the host.
meanings.sent3: The prologues of the movie night were filled with laughter and popcorn.
meanings.sent4: The prologues of the race were the starting line buzzing with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The prologues of the play were the actors preparing backstage.
